customer_reviews.title: Great craftsmanship. I was expecting something a bit cheaper ...
customer_reviews.text: Great craftsmanship. I was expecting something a bit cheaper but was pleasantly surprised. The only issue I have with landing pad is the weaving loops where you slide the yellow plastic holding spikes slide in horizontally, meaning you need to slide the spike horizontally then twist 90 degrees to drive down into the grass/terrain. I have a quick solution for does that also have that same issue; simply go to Lowe's and buy a couple key rings then slide them onto the weaving loops. Enjoy your flight, Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You need one of these if you take off on soft surfaces
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried to launch my drone on 2" long grass, I was dismayed too see my drone flip over as the props tangled in the grass. I knew then that I had to get a landing pad. This one looked like a good value. It folds into a compact package. You need to practice the technique for folding it. It is similar to folding some photo reflectors. So far it is holding up well. I haven't had to stake it yet, but they are also included. This is a nice package and a GREAT gift idea for someone just getting in to droning.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Good Overall Takeoff/landing Pad
customer_reviews.text: This pad is large enough that it’s easy to takeoff/land wth my Mavic Pro. Folds/unfolds easily and has a ver small footprint when folded. If you’re taking off from concrete then you can just unfold this thing and go. If you’re taking off from grass or any other uneven surface I find it best to place cardboard under the pad. Other reviews indicate the pad falling apart after folding too many times, I’ve had mine for about 3 months without any of those issues. All in all a good option for a takeoff landing pad.
customer_reviews.author: Cody T

customer_reviews.title: All Drone Owners need one of these. !
customer_reviews.text: This is a great landing pad. Took only 2 tries to figure out how to fold it back into it case. This is an essential for all drone owners. I use it on the cement or the grass. When first learning to fly high grass can def hit the blades, but this pad is large enough where you have a good buffer. People also love watching the drone take off and land on it's own little helipad. It also makes you look that more proficient when you get your drone to do a perfect center of the pad landing.. I have a Mavic Air and the pad works great with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric N.

customer_reviews.title: Travel Lite Glow In The Dark UAV Landing Pad
